sentences.chinese: 广博的中世纪文学知识

sentences.chinese: 所有多余的东西被售卖一空来增加他们的收入。

sentences.chinese: 抽水机启动了，船员们开始用水将火浇灭。

sentences.chinese: 铲除所有异己的残酷独裁者

sentences.chinese: 能源浪费

sentences.chinese: 宗教狂热分子

sentences.chinese: 有人偷了我的信用卡，并假冒我的签名。

a place where metal is heated and shaped into objects

sentences.chinese: 该教会看来处于分裂的边缘。

sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.chinese: 他牺牲了自己的事业，其目的是让他贪婪的弟弟成功。

detailed_translations.english: An avaricious person is very greedy for money or possessions

sentences.english: Her ex-husband had always hoped for a reconciliation.
sentences.chinese: 她的前夫一直想和她重归于好。

sentences.english: The treaty has brought a new spirit of reconciliation on both sides.

sentences.chinese: 他的回复几乎让人听不懂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 逼真，貌似真实；逼真的事物
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being true or real

sentences.english: Williams took a more pragmatic approach to management problems.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯在管理问题上采用的是一种更务实的做法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝；否定；批判；与…断绝关系；拒付
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept or continue with something

sentences.english: Retail sales are a gauge of consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 零售额是衡量消费支出的一个标准。

detailed_translations.english: an instrument for measuring the size or amount of something
to measure or calculate something by using a particular instrument or method

sentences.english: I’m worried about washing that shirt in case it shrinks.
sentences.chinese: 我不太敢洗那件衬衫，怕它会缩水。

detailed_translations.english: to become smaller, or to make something smaller, through the effects of heat or water

sentences.chinese: 在日本看来，不解决这个问题，就不可能与朝鲜恢复任何形式的友好关系。

sentences.english: ...esoteric knowledge.
sentences.chinese: …深奥难懂的知识。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe something as esoteric, you mean it is known, understood, or appreciated by only a small number of people

sentences.english: They pant after liberation.
sentences.chinese: 他们渴望解放。

sentences.english: All his life was submerged in the liberation of the people.
sentences.chinese: 他的一生全部献身于人民的解放事业。

sentences.chinese: 他们把生命献给了祖国的解放事业。

sentences.chinese: 我把另一个儿子送到乡下和亲戚住在一起。

detailed_translations.english: an idea, remark etc that is germane to something is related to it in an important and suitable way

sentences.english: We represent the last vestige of what made this nation great – hard work.
sentences.chinese: 我们代表了曾经使这个国家伟大的仅存的品质–勤奋。

detailed_translations.english: a small part or amount of something that remains when most of it no longer exists

sentences.english: The kids were screaming with delight.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在高兴地尖叫。

sentences.english: He is delighting audiences with his wit and humour.
sentences.chinese: 他在用自己的智慧和幽默娱乐观众。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great pleasure and satisfaction
to give someone great satisfaction and enjoyment

sentences.english: Sarah was loath to tell her mother what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉不愿意告诉母亲所发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: to be unwilling to do something

sentences.chinese: 贸易不是世界经济或社会弊端的万灵丹。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that something is a panacea for a set of problems, you mean that it will solve all those problems

sentences.english: The ethics committee may take a decision to admonish him or to censure him.
sentences.chinese: 道德规范委员会可能决定对他进行警告或批评。

detailed_translations.english: If you censure someone for something that they have done, you tell them that you strongly disapprove of it
the act of expressing strong disapproval and criticism

sentences.english: The prisoners were held in deplorable conditions .
sentences.chinese: 囚犯被关押在极其恶劣的环境里。

sentences.english: His conduct was deplorable.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为令人震惊。

detailed_translations.english: very bad, unpleasant, and shocking

sentences.english: White House officials ordered Williams to recant.
sentences.chinese: 白宫官员命令威廉斯公开宣布放弃自己的观点。

sentences.english: The theory is based on the assumption of labor homogeneity.
sentences.chinese: 劳动价值论是建立在劳动同质性假设基础上的。

sentences.english: Differentiation to general meaning is referring things transmit from homogeneity to heterogeneity.
sentences.chinese: 分化在一般意义上是指事物从同质性向异质性的转变。

sentences.english: But it responded to a hostility to Islam and a craving for security and cultural homogeneity that is finding adherents across the western world — and not just on the far right.
sentences.chinese: 不过，它回应了对伊斯兰的敌意和对安全及文化同质的渴望，而这两者在整个西方世界——而不仅仅是在极右翼人群中——的支持者越来越多。

sentences.english: The coating has good tenacity and wearability.
sentences.chinese: 涂层具有良好的韧性和耐磨性能。

sentences.english: High strength, good rigidity and tenacity, good heat and seawater resisting, good Cl resisting, suitable for high performance products.
sentences.chinese: 高机械强度，高耐热性，韧性好，具有较好的耐海水、耐氯性。适用于高性能制品。

sentences.chinese: 他们喜欢五星级酒店和谦恭的礼遇。

sentences.english: The hum of the tyres on the road lulled her to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 一路上滚滚的车轮声使她昏昏欲睡。

sentences.chinese: 现任总统选举结束以后，政治暴力曾暂时平息。

A lull is a period of quiet or calm in a longer period of activity or excitement

sentences.chinese: 大麻可以为一些癌症患者减轻疼痛。

sentences.english: money raised for the relief effort
sentences.chinese: 为赈灾筹集的钱款

detailed_translations.english: when something reduces someone’s pain or unhappy feelings

sentences.english: Some skittish Wall Street investors are staying away from the market.
sentences.chinese: 一些患得患失的华尔街投资者不敢入市。

sentences.english: Children become fractious when they are tired.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子累了就容易发脾气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易怒的；倔强的，难以对待的

sentences.english: A lot of people need a tonic at the end of the winter.

detailed_translations.english: to help someone to live a healthy, useful, or active life again after they have been seriously ill or in prison

sentences.english: The shareholders have manifested their intention to sell the shares.
sentences.chinese: 股东们表明了要出售股票的意图。

detailed_translations.english: to show a feeling, attitude etc
a list of passengers or goods carried on a ship, plane, or train
plain and easy to see

sentences.chinese: …伦敦美术馆里文艺复兴时期的杰作。

detailed_translations.english: a new interest in something, especially a particular form of art, music etc, that has not been popular for a long period

sentences.english: an eloquent appeal for support
sentences.chinese: 极具说服力的求助呼吁

detailed_translations.english: able to express your ideas and opinions well, especially in a way that influences people

sentences.english: the conundrum of our purpose on Earth
sentences.chinese: 我们为何目的活在世上这一难题

detailed_translations.english: a confusing and difficult problem

sentences.english: the pervasive influence of television
sentences.chinese: 电视无所不在的影响

sentences.english: the all-pervasive mood of apathy

detailed_translations.chinese: 普遍的；到处渗透的；流行的
detailed_translations.english: existing everywhere

sentences.chinese: 低音吉他开始砰然作响，震得我的脑袋嗡嗡的。

sentences.chinese: 说我酒后驾车，这真是太荒唐了。

sentences.chinese: 法院裁定他获得区区100英镑损害赔偿。

sentences.english: Love and fear are two of the most elemental human emotions.
sentences.chinese: 爱和恐惧是人类最基本的两种情感。

sentences.english: the elemental fury of the storm
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨的肆虐

detailed_translations.english: simple, basic, and important

sentences.english: embryonic development
sentences.chinese: 胚胎的发育

sentences.english: embryonic cells
sentences.chinese: 胚胎细胞

sentences.english: a primitive society
sentences.chinese: 原始社会

sentences.english: primitive art
sentences.chinese: 原始艺术

sentences.english: The first station buildings were quite primitive.
sentences.chinese: 最初的车站建筑很简陋。

sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.chinese: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

detailed_translations.english: something that is visible can be seen

sentences.chinese: 我可以全心全意地支持他们的观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名

detailed_translations.chinese: 好捣乱的；好搞派系的；源于派别的

sentences.english: They admonished me for taking risks with my health.
sentences.chinese: 他们告诫我不要拿自己的健康来冒险。

sentences.chinese: 政府军已经成功抓获叛乱分子的头目。

sentences.english: 40 captured French soldiers
sentences.chinese: 40名被俘虏的法国士兵

detailed_translations.english: to catch a person and keep them as a prisoner

sentences.chinese: 他每天都去健身房，纯粹出于自我欣赏。

sentences.chinese: 这支球队已经连胜五场了。

sentences.chinese: 历届政府都试图解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: coming or following one after the other

sentences.chinese: 他差点被烟熏得窒息了。

sentences.english: Despite their superficial similarities, the two novels are, in fact, very different.
sentences.chinese: 这两本小说尽管表面上有相似之处，但实际上大不一样。

sentences.chinese: 他们对监狱生活只有最粗浅的了解。

sentences.english: If the list is too long, it will be truncated by the computer.
sentences.chinese: 如果列表太长，电脑会将其截短。

sentences.chinese: 该报告还有简缩版。

detailed_translations.english: to make something shorter

sentences.chinese: 精明的政治顾问

detailed_translations.english: clever, careful, and not easily deceived, especially in business or politics

sentences.english: His business acumen helped him to succeed where others had failed.
sentences.chinese: 他在商业上的敏锐帮他在其他人失败的地方获得成功。

sentences.english: Science considers to make clear, the baby is to comparative to outside information of acumen, acceptance rate is quite rapid also.
sentences.chinese: 科学研究表明，婴儿对外界信息是相当敏锐的，接受的速度也相当快。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to think quickly and make good judgments

sentences.english: We recoil in horror from the thought of subjecting someone to extreme pain.
sentences.chinese: 想到要让一个人经受极度的痛苦，我们就会恐惧地退缩。

sentences.english: ...his small body jerking in recoil from the volume of his shouting.
sentences.chinese: …他小小身体在他大声的叫喊中畏缩地抽搐着。

sentences.english: He deflected the blow with his forearm.
sentences.chinese: 他用前臂挡开了打来的一拳。

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something deflects something that is moving, or if it deflects, it turns in a different direction

sentences.english: The president alone betokened the national identity.
sentences.chinese: 总统一人就代表了国家形象。

detailed_translations.english: to be a sign of something

sentences.english: artless sincerity
sentences.chinese: 天真烂漫

detailed_translations.chinese: 天真的；朴实的；无虚饰的
detailed_translations.english: natural, honest, and sincere

sentences.english: ...Larkin's tendency to disparage literature.
sentences.chinese: …拉金诋毁文学的倾向。

detailed_translations.english: If you disparage someone or something, you speak about them in a way which shows that you do not have a good opinion of them

sentences.chinese: 在中学里曾经冷落她的那些男孩

an act of snubbing someone

sentences.english: She enjoys a firm reputation in this country but wider international success has been elusive.
sentences.chinese: 她在这个国家享有稳固的声誉，但却一直难以在国际上取得更大的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难懂的；易忘的；逃避的；难捉摸的
detailed_translations.english: an elusive result is difficult to achieve

sentences.english: You might expect politicians to smooth things out when civil servants are being dilatory.
sentences.chinese: 当公务员办事拖拉时，你可能期望政治家们能够把事情顺利解决。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拖拉的；缓慢的，不慌不忙的
detailed_translations.english: slow in doing something

sentences.chinese: 要是你听见我的名誉受到诽谤， 你会相信那谗言吗?。

sentences.chinese: 这些评论者不但没有对弗林一事的消息泄露做出诽谤，还赞扬这是对问责新闻的贡献。

sentences.english: We cast no aspersion on the man or his program. Mr. Obama, in his short career, has not strongly associated himself with any policy idea.
sentences.chinese: 我们无意诽谤这个人或他的计划，然而奥巴马先生在他短暂的职业生涯里，从未对任何政策主张表现过强烈支持的态度。

sentences.english: The whole show went without a hitch .
sentences.chinese: 整场演出进行得非常顺利。

detailed_translations.english: a small problem that makes something difficult or delays it for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 搭便车；钩住；套住；猛拉；使结婚
detailed_translations.english: to get free rides from the drivers of passing cars by standing at the side of the road and putting a hand out with the thumb raised

sentences.english: a staid old bachelor
sentences.chinese: 一个古板的老光棍

detailed_translations.chinese: 固定的；沉着的；沉静的；古板的，保守的

sentences.english: She is such a gregarious and outgoing person.
sentences.chinese: 她就是这样一个爱社交而且外向的人。

detailed_translations.english: friendly and preferring to be with other people

sentences.english: In the somber archives of a sedate museum a large archaic volume is somewhat conspicuously displayed.
sentences.chinese: 在一个平静的博物馆中昏暗的档案室里，一本厚厚的古书被摆在了很显著的位置。

sentences.english: Her 71-year-old husband, looking somber and composed, was brought into the church in a wheelchair and did not speak at the service.
sentences.chinese: 凯西71岁高龄的丈夫被人用轮椅推进教堂，看起来沉默忧郁，在葬礼仪式上也没有发言。

sentences.english: Don't ignore it because it makes you laugh — director Paul Feig's 2011 hit deserves as much respect as any somber, wintry, subtitled drama.
sentences.chinese: 不要因为它让你开怀大笑而忽略了它——总监保罗·法伊格在2011年引起的这场轩然大波与其他任何忧郁、寒冷、次要的戏剧一样值得尊重。

sentences.english: the camaraderie of the women’s basketball team
sentences.chinese: 女子篮球队的队友情谊

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of friendship that a group of people have, especially when they work together

sentences.english: a solemn expression
sentences.chinese: 严肃的表情

sentences.chinese: 他们的脸突然变得严肃起来。

sentences.english: a solemn procession of mourners
sentences.chinese: 庄重的送葬队伍

sentences.english: solemn ritual/ceremony
sentences.chinese: 隆重的仪式/典礼

detailed_translations.chinese: 严肃的，庄重的；庄严的,隆重的
detailed_translations.english: very serious and not happy, for example because something bad has happened or because you are at an important occasion

sentences.english: The cat became lethargic and had trouble breathing.
sentences.chinese: 这只猫整天昏睡而且呼吸困难。

sentences.english: The koala seemed to be asleep, and I wondered for the first time just how one went about startling such a lethargic creature.
sentences.chinese: 那只树熊似乎睡着了。 第一次干这活儿，我真不知怎么去惊吓一只昏睡的动物。

sentences.english: The organisers say they are also considering giving a prize to the slowest cell, since lethargic cells would be a boon for cancer therapy.

sentences.chinese: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

sentences.english: So how do we strengthen our skeptical skills?
sentences.chinese: 那么，我们如何加强自身的怀疑技能呢？

sentences.english: Not all theory that we read in this course is skeptical.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这门课中提及的理论不全是怀疑性的。

sentences.english: L.M.:Well, I was skeptical myself in the beginning. But these are facts. The findings are very reproducible and we are waiting for confirmation by other labs.
sentences.chinese: 大爷：我老人家一开始也是很怀疑的。但是这个是事实。这个发现可以被反复验证，我们正在等待别的实验是的验证。

sentences.english: He stood silent and inscrutable.
sentences.chinese: 他静静地站着，让人难以捉摸。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神秘的；不可理解的；不能预测的；不可思议的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is inscrutable shows no emotion or reaction in the expression on their face so that it is impossible to know what they are feeling or thinking

sentences.english: the singular form of the noun
sentences.chinese: 该名词的单数形式

sentences.english: If the subject is singular, use a singular verb.
sentences.chinese: 如果主语是单数，就用单数动词。

sentences.english: a singular achievement
sentences.chinese: 非凡的成就

detailed_translations.english: a singular noun, verb, form etc is used when writing or speaking about one person or thing

sentences.english: Unfounded rumours of accounting problems hit stocks of other companies.
sentences.chinese: 有关账目问题的无根据的谣言打击了其他公司的股票。

detailed_translations.english: unfounded statements, feelings, opinions etc are wrong because they are not based on facts

sentences.english: The more the physical causes incline mankind to inaction, the more the moral causes should estrange them from it.
sentences.chinese: 所以，物质的因素越使他们趋于懈怠时，精神的因素就越使他们远离物质的因素。

sentences.english: Their specific treatment of volume, apertures, and overall geometry interested us as tools to estrange conventional ideas of residential housing.
sentences.chinese: 该建筑在体量、孔径和整体几何形状上的处理手法都激发我们有了远离传统住宅的想法。

sentences.english: a decisive factor/victory/battle
sentences.chinese: 决定性的因素 / 胜利 / 战役

sentences.english: a decisive leader
sentences.chinese: 果断的领袖

detailed_translations.english: very important for the final result of a particular situation

sentences.english: He appeared very composed despite the stress he was under.
sentences.chinese: 尽管压力很大，他看起来仍十分镇定。

detailed_translations.english: seeming calm and not upset or angry

detailed_translations.chinese: 组成；作曲（compose的过去分词）；著作

sentences.english: She was as capricious as her mother had been.
sentences.chinese: 她和她母亲当初一样反复无常。

detailed_translations.english: likely to change your mind suddenly or behave in an unexpected way

sentences.english: undeniable proof
sentences.chinese: 确证

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可否认的, 无可辩驳的
detailed_translations.english: definitely true or certain

sentences.english: Despite his unprepossessing appearance, he was very popular with women.
sentences.chinese: 他虽然其貌不扬，但很有女人缘。

detailed_translations.english: not very attractive or noticeable

sentences.english: Fortunately my suspicions proved groundless .
sentences.chinese: 幸好我的猜疑后来证明是没有根据的。

sentences.english: Mr Kay’s lawyer said the accusations were groundless.
sentences.chinese: 凯先生的律师说这是无端的指控。

detailed_translations.english: not based on facts or reason

sentences.english: Doctors are complaining that the system is cumbersome and bureaucratic.
sentences.chinese: 医生抱怨说该体制复杂繁琐，很官僚。

sentences.english: cumbersome procedures
sentences.chinese: 繁琐的程序

detailed_translations.chinese: 笨重的；累赘的；难处理的
detailed_translations.english: a process or system that is cumbersome is slow and difficult

sentences.english: She gave a reluctant smile.
sentences.chinese: 她勉强笑了笑。

detailed_translations.english: slow and unwilling

sentences.english: implacable enemies
sentences.chinese: 死敌

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能安抚的；难和解的；不能缓和的

sentences.english: a nebulous ghostly figure
sentences.chinese: 幽灵般朦胧的身影

detailed_translations.chinese: 朦胧的；星云的，星云状的
detailed_translations.english: a shape that is nebulous is unclear and has no definite edges

sentences.english: But it can also inspire and uplift and exalt, because power can be used to help people accomplish marvelous things.
sentences.chinese: 但是，权力也可以激励人、振奋人和提升人，因为它可以帮助人们成就非同寻常的事业。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something into a high rank or position

sentences.english: jejune political opinions
sentences.chinese: 幼稚的政治观点

detailed_translations.english: ideas that are jejune are too simple

sentences.english: Insect populations fluctuate wildly from year to year.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的数量每年变化很大。

sentences.english: Prices were volatile, fluctuating between 20 and 40.
sentences.chinese: 价格不稳定，在20至40美元之间波动。

detailed_translations.english: to change frequently in size, amount, quality, etc., especially from one extreme to another

sentences.english: For the French team, winning tomorrow’s game is a matter of national honor.
sentences.chinese: 对法国队来说，打赢明天的比赛事关国家荣誉。

detailed_translations.english: the respect that you, your family, your country etc receive from other people, which makes you feel proud

sentences.english: We stand together now in mutual support and in reverence for the dead.
sentences.chinese: 出于相互支持和对逝者的敬意，我们现在站到了一起。

detailed_translations.english: great respect and admiration for someone or something

sentences.english: Everyone hates the prolix Gadaffi, particularly Arab despots who he routinely blasts as  “old women in robes,” “Zionist lackeys,” and “cowards and thieves.
sentences.chinese: 任何一个痛恨卡扎菲说话罗嗦的人，尤其是阿拉伯独裁君主们，他们例行公事似地攻击卡扎菲是“穿着长袍的老女人”，“犹太复国主义走狗”，和“懦夫和小偷”。

detailed_translations.english: a prolix piece of writing has too many words and is boring

sentences.english: His speeches tend to be rather long-winded.
sentences.chinese: 他的演说往往都很冗长乏味。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to talk for too long or using too many words in a way that is boring

sentences.english: He is a protean stylist who can move from blues to ballads and grand symphony.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位富有变化的艺术家，能从布鲁斯转换到民谣以及雄壮的交响乐。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变化多端的， 多变的
detailed_translations.english: able to keep changing or to do many things

sentences.english: an unpredictable and fickle lover
sentences.chinese: 一个捉摸不透、三心二意的情人

detailed_translations.chinese: 浮躁的；易变的；变幻无常的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is fickle is always changing their mind about people or things that they like, so that you cannot depend on them – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: Roman relics found in a field
sentences.chinese: 在野外发现的古罗马遗迹

detailed_translations.english: an old object or custom that reminds people of the past or that has lived on from a past time

sentences.english: To the chagrin of their parents, neither Phil nor Pam went to church anymore.
sentences.chinese: 令父母失望的是，菲尔和帕姆都再也不去教堂了。

detailed_translations.english: annoyance and disappointment because something has not happened the way you hoped
to feel annoyed and disappointed

sentences.english: These causes, however, never served to exculpate "ordinary Germans" who shared in the guilt either for participating in or not resisting Nazi rule in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 但这些原因，都不足以证明所谓“德国平民”是无罪的，因为他们有些也参与了这场罪行，至少并没有反抗纳粹在德国的统治。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开脱； 申明无罪， 证明无罪
detailed_translations.english: to prove that someone is not guilty of something

sentences.english: Some portions of the bill may contravene state law.
sentences.chinese: 这项议案中的一些部分可能与州法律相抵触。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that is not allowed according to a law or rule

sentences.english: the salient points of the report
sentences.chinese: 这份报告的要点

detailed_translations.english: the salient points or features of something are the most important or most noticeable parts of it

sentences.english: an actor noted for his mercurial temperament
sentences.chinese: 以性情反复无常而出名的一名男演员

detailed_translations.chinese: 水银的；水星的；墨丘利神的；雄辩机智的；活泼善变的
detailed_translations.english: containing mercury

sentences.english: the artist’s prodigious output
sentences.chinese: 那位艺术家惊人的高产

detailed_translations.chinese: 惊人的，异常的，奇妙的；巨大的
detailed_translations.english: very large or great in a surprising or impressive way

sentences.english: A section of the reading public has an insatiable appetite for dirty stories about the famous.
sentences.chinese: 阅读大众中有一部分人对名人的风流韵事的欲望总是无法满足。

detailed_translations.english: always wanting more and more of something

sentences.english: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.chinese: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.english: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.english: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

sentences.english: His confidence is at a low ebb.
sentences.chinese: 他的信心很低落。

detailed_translations.english: the flow of the sea away from the shore, when the tide goes out
if the tide ebbs, it flows away from the shore

sentences.english: Usually his cases involved errant husbands and wandering wives.
sentences.chinese: 通常他接手的案子都涉及出轨的丈夫和离家出走的妻子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不定的；周游的；错误的；偏离正路的
detailed_translations.english: Errant is used to describe someone whose actions are considered unacceptable or wrong by other people. For example, an errant husband is unfaithful to his wife.

sentences.english: ...a delightful river with a profusion of wild flowers along its banks.
sentences.chinese: ...一条令人愉悦的河，岸上开满了野花。

detailed_translations.english: a very large amount of something

sentences.english: the prevalent belief in astrology
sentences.chinese: 对占星术的普遍相信

detailed_translations.english: common at a particular time, in a particular place, or among a particular group of people

sentences.english: an engaging smile
sentences.chinese: 迷人的微笑

detailed_translations.chinese: 迷人的， 美丽动人的
detailed_translations.english: pleasant and attracting your interest

sentences.english: I had hopes of escaping my quotidian world.
sentences.chinese: 我曾希望能逃离自己的日常生活。

detailed_translations.english: Quotidian activities or experiences are basic, everyday activities or experiences

sentences.english: Don't succumb to the temptation to have just one cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 不要屈服于只抽一支烟的诱惑。

detailed_translations.english: to stop opposing someone or something that is stronger than you, and allow them to take control

sentences.english: In such circumstances, governments must do all they can to create and engender trust among its nation’s constituents and institutions.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，政府必须尽其所能在它的国家选民和公共机构之间创造和产生信任。

sentences.english: Retrospectives on the process and working practices regularly capture the lessons learned by the project and engender a culture of continuous process improvement within the project.
sentences.chinese: 对过程和工作实践的回顾有规律地捕捉从项目中得到的经验，并在项目中造成一个持续的过程改进的文化。

sentences.english: The bomb was planted by right-wing extremists.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹是右翼极端分子放置的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has extreme political opinions and aims, and who is willing to do unusual or illegal things in order to achieve them
